description:
Excellent little burger and happy hour drink spot. 

I have come in a few times for lunch and have tried the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and the 1/2 lb Burger (two patties). The food is incredibly fresh and unique (for as unique as a burger place can be). They have two types of sauce that you can choose from; Shack Sauce which is a mixture of ketchup, mustard and mayo; and an aioli with garlic (I believe...?). Onions and pickles are upon request, and upgrades are $0.50-$1.00 each (avo, grilled onions, etc.). The burgers and chicken were both cooked to perfect - hot, moist and tender. The bun appears on the big side, but is not doughy or too chewy and is a great match for the insides. The fries are also my favorite type: the standard 1/4 inch thick cut crisp and golden. So many places fall short on fresh and crispy fries that Burger Shack should get some extra points for the quality here. 

There is limited seating, but I have not had any issue finding a seat. The staff are warm and friendly, and geared toward providing excellent service. The food arrives quick too, especially considering it is not started until ordered. The right side of the restaurant features a full bar and few taps with standard beer options. I will likely pop in before I head home from work in the near future. 

All in all, this is all one can ask for in a a local burger spot. Excellent food, service, clean atmosphere and decent prices! Burgers range about $8-10 after tax. I hear they are new to the area, so I hope they continue to get more business. They are a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Neville V.

description:
WARNING: Despite offering vegetarian options, stay away from the impossible burger if you are vegetarian/vegan. It isn't steamed or grilled like other places. Instead it's deep-fried in the same oil as the fried chicken! It's extra crispy on the outside, dry on the inside, and tastes like chicken grease throughout.

Not only was the burger overcooked, the curly fries were undercooked. One of the fries was even still raw on the inside. When I returned the food the staff first suggested I take it home and cook it more, then proceeded to tell me I was wrong and that it was supposed to be line that. I was excited after seeing several positive reviews, but I won't ever be coming back. Oh well.

Edit: Second star for partial refund.
author: Nick W.

description:
Great new burger spot in North Beach. Burger is shake shack style, but with more options for the add-ons that are all delicious.

Music selection on point.
author: Michael C.

description:
Burger Shack was my first meal of the day on a day of walking when I was out exploring the piers.  Yelp sent me up Bay Street and right to Burger Shack.  So happy I came!

I walked in around 2pm and was the only customer, but within 20 minutes it was packed and the flavors are why.  I ordered their 1/2 lb burger ($8.75), and side of french fries ($3).  What'd I think?

The 1/2 lb burger came with two patties lettuce, tomato and house mayo.  I also added cheddar cheese ($1) and there's ketchup and mustard pumps if you're not done with condiments.

This burger was a mouthfull, was cooked to order, and filled me up.  Admittedly, the patties themselves were not seasoned, but I enjoyed this burger.

The french fries were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and these were nicely seasoned.  I'd order both again.

Customer service was nice, quick, and stopped by to check on me from time to time.  Interior was clean and while there is a bar, I will say there aren't a large amount of tables.  Maybe 25 people can sit here at a time.

I enjoyed this place, and the reviews lived up to the meal with me.  Give these guys a shot!
author: Jamarcus T.

description: Great food, very friendly and very clean. Definitely worth trying and we'll definately be back next time we're in town!
author: Linn A.

description:
I ordered the crispy  chicken sandwich and my friend a turkey burger and they both taste like frozen food. No flavor and the only good thing was the little kid taking our order.
I would never come in here again.
author: Vale O.

description:
Having just slagged two North Beach takeout-oriented venues -- Cilantro and North Beach Pizza -- I wanted to karmically give credit where credit is due.

Like Cilantro, BURGER SHACK is a new North Beach launch. They, too, made an effort with renovations and remodelling.

But more important, their product!

Now, I am not a big red-meat eater but if I crave a burger and fries this place does it better than Mel's -- and with Nieman Ranch beef!

For all of the yoginis, Burger Shack actually does Yam fries. 

Before posting this review, I have recommended Burger Shack through word-of-mouth, and I think they run a tight operation.
author: Paul A.

description: The burger was fantastic and the owner was really friendly!  I'll for sure be back next time I'm in town, maybe once more while I'm here.
author: Jason C.

description:
I was hesitant at first coming here as it's new to the neighborhood and haven't had great experiences with some of the other places around here.... boy was I wrong!  I got the 1/2 Shack burger and tried some of the crispy chicken sandwich and was blown away.  The burger was cooked just how I asked (med rare) which I feel like most places aren't really great at, and very juicy.  The chicken sandwich was very tasty and had homemade slaw on it.  On top of that, they have draft beer and a full bar, very clean place and very friendly staff!

5 stars all day long
author: Brandon K.

description:
Burger shack is located a few blocks up from fishman's wharf, across from the North point shopping center. I saw very positive reviews on Yelp about their burger and I can confirm it doesn't disappoint. I ordered the 1/4th lb Shack Burger with Swiss cheese and curly fries.

Shack burger: A+
The keys to a good burger are the thickness of the patty and texture of the bun. Burger shack does these two keys justice! The burger is thinly pounded and the bread is very soft like a brioche bun. In terms of taste, the burger has an outstanding umami flavor especially with the cheese. It's very easy to bite into and doesn't fall apart. I'd recommend getting the 1/2lb burger if you really like meat. The shack sauce is comparable to in&out sauce and adds a nice flavor compared to just mayo.

Curly fries: B
Not the greatest curly fries ever but they still taste good and are a bit crispy. They give a decent amount too. Fries are not included with the burger so it's $3-4 as a side.

Service was mediocre, the lady seemed to be working double duty as she was busy dealing with orders, making milkshakes, and sorting out Togo orders. Food came out very quick though and the prices aren't too bad for a really delicious burger. Highly recommend if you're a burger fanatic!

Food: 4.5/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 3/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
Evening flight from New Jersey to San Francisco's Burger Shack exceeded expectations again and again!

The burger, the fresh vegetables cut and trimmed properly and the perfectly fresh bun pulls this all together to compliment the Niman's Ranch Beef Burger!!

Best consumed immediately.
author: Gary W.

description: I ordered a Shack 1/4 pound burger with regular fries and a fountain drink. The total came to $13 for everything. The burger looked like something out of a magazine. It wasn't falling all over the place and sloppy. It had a tooth pick holding it together in one place. The fries were fries, they came hot, not salted, but they were fine. I think they could scale back on their pricing being that they are new to the neighborhood and need to fill the seats. The place was empty during lunch time and that could be a huge deterrent for the locals and tourist who are looking for a place to eat.
author: Amanda J.

description: 3.5 Star... lets start with their food. Their burger is nothing wow about. I paid extra for a fried egg which was fully cook. Would be better if the yolk was oozing out. Their mojito drink from the bar was light and not very good. Last their place is pretty small. The reason for the positive star was because their price is good and service was great! They were very nice to ask one customer sitting by himself at a table of 6 to move to a single seat table  so our family of 8 can seat there. The bartender even brought us the mojito from the bar to our table. Last their curly fries and sweet potato fries was pretty good. Overall we enjoyed it.
author: Christy V.

description: Great food and fantastic people!! The place is very close to the piers. The burger is by far one of the best I ever eaten
author: Iakovos L.

description:
Clean. Happy hour from 3-6. Reasonably priced. 

I had the mushroom Swiss quarter pounder and fries for under $10.
author: Helen C.

description:
One word to describe " delicious "
Everything fresh!
The house sauce amazing.
I wish they have one location in Chicago
author: Piotr K.

description:
I'm so happy I stumbled upon this place shortly before it closed Sunday night. I'm not usually in the mood for a burger but it was close to the hotel and actually sounded good. 

I felt like it was my lucky day when their shake of the month was banana. This is my FAVORITE shake flavor which obviously isn't very common and I have to say this was probably the best one I've yet to enjoy.

Ordered the Cheeseburger with their shake sauce which I was hesitant about at first as the gentleman working told me it was a mixture of ketchup, mustard, mayo, and their special spices. I'm normally not a fan of any of those sauces but love 'thousand island' on a burger. This was very similar and worked great on the burger. I wasn't asked how I wanted the burger cooked but it was a perfect medium and tasted quite delicious. Oh and order their curly fries; better than any fast food establishment for sure. 

This place is clean and everyone I met working was extremely friendly. I'm guessing a family business so I hope they succeed as I want that banana milkshake next time I'm back in town!
author: Savanna L.

description:
I was on vacation in Sf and was craving a juicy burger so I jumped on yelped. I saw the pictures and said let's go check it out. Parking in sf is a drag,  I parked in a spot I thought I could park but was told I couldn't by the owner. He than saw someone leave from a previous spot and told me to go there. (Thanks for being helpful! Very much appreciated) Anywho the cashier that attended us was nice and had a bright smile as she took my order. I got two shack burgers with curly and the other with French fries. They were delicious and made fresh! 
The presentation was good. 
The building itself was nice. They have a full bar to btw! 
Really recommend for anyone to stop in and enjoy a good burger!
author: Alex A.

description:
This is an okay place based on my one visit. I'm a huge fan of fried chicken sandwiches and noticed this place had them. 

I ordered a fried chicken sandwich, Oreo shake, and garlic fries. The garlic fries were nothing special and my favorite part was the Oreo shake. It's not overly sweet but still tasty.

The major deduction comes from the fried chicken sandwich. It's really a let down to all fried chicken sandwiches. It tastes like a McChicken. It's really underwhelming in terms of presentation and taste. The chicken has almost no flavor and the other toppings are more flavorful than the chicken. 

This place seems to be known for its burger which I'll be happy to come back and try, but I really don't recommend the fried chicken sandwich.
author: Vinh T.

description: Really nice family run joint where the food is really well done. Highly recommend over the crowded fisherman's wharf places. The family that runs the store is amazingly sweet and go out of their way to make the experience pleasant.
author: Humair B.

description:
One of the best burgers I've had in SF. The management here does a great job and they have big plans for this place. I talked to Raymond for a hour while watching the World Series game 5 and you have to love how much commitment and effort his family puts into this shop.

1/2 lb patty was perfect size. Burger was stacked, toppings are worth the extra cost! Also the beef was perfectly cooked and very savory. I typically like my burgers to be greasy, but this was the perfect combo of greasy and healthy! The only thing I would have changed was to make the egg more runny -- it was a little overcooked, but that's just my personal preference.

Additionally, I thought the garlic fries were on point. Why get Gilroy Garlic fries at McD's when you can come here and get the real deal!

Highly recommend overall!
author: Vasiliy M.

description:
I've lived in this neighborhood for approximately 8 years, so I was a little skeptical to eat here based on the previous tenants. However, based on the reviews I read I decided to give it a whirl. 

The place is a little unassuming, but I'm happy to report that I will be going back. I had a double Shack Burger with grilled onions and an order of garlic fries.. I think the burger needed a little seasoning but overall it was juicy and delicious. And the fries were crispy and tasty. 

This is a welcome addition to the area and I'm hoping they get good business.
author: Craig G.

description:
I live right around the corner, and I have to admit that I was extremely skeptical about Burger Shack, given that its previous incarnation as China House was horrible. However, their burgers are good and their garlic fries are excellent. 

I ordered their 1/2 pound double burger with cheddar, and it was good. The meat was fresh,  juicy, and very substantial. The bun seemed a little soft. The only downside was that the meat seemed a little soft and underseasoned. 

The garlic fries were excellent - better than the garlic fries at the ballpark! They're nice and garlicky. Now I do I eat a lot of burgers, and Burger Shack is good, but it's a notch below Super Duper, Wes Burger, and In N Out, but definitely a cut above a regular fast food burger.
author: Allen T.

description:
The husband and I hit up this spot for a quick bite before seeing some stand-up comedy at Cobbs. 

Great, juicy burgers and thick but still crunchy  fries, fast and friendly service, and a full bar?!? What a nice way to start the night. 

Another family-owned business we'll continue to support:)
author: N. V.

description:
We're so happy to have a new place open up in north beach so close to home! It's sad seeing all the buildings without businesses. They opened last week & we popped in walking home one night after dinner to check out the menu. 

Went back for lunch the next day & they have Basic American foods - but good for the family since kids will eat almost anything on the menu. We got the double burger, curly fries & jalapeño poppers. The burger was HUGE - juicy, their sauce is good,
Maybe cooked a little too long. The curly fries were great - hard to go wrong there. But the jalapeño poppers were a let down. They didn't have much flavor and TBH kinda seemed like they were the frozen ones you get at Costco. They could make them sooooo much better with some seasoning / hot sauce if they're homemade. 

They have a tv & the bar is opening soon, we'll go again. 

Prices are reasonable for sf
author: danielle a.

description:
I'm not a big red meat eater but every once in a while I get a craving...I don't ever waste it on fast food burgers and when I have a really good one, I'm reminded why it's worth the wait.

The owner (I'm assuming) greeted me with a big, genuine, welcoming smile and I loved the simple menu and the reassurance of non-antibiotic/hormone meat. 

I got avocado, cheddar add ons and it was a perfect lunch for a hungry work day. I would recommend it and return when in the area for sure.
author: Tanya W.

description:
I live in Los Angeles and I came to sf with some friends for a road trip and we stumbled upon this burger place that was a 5 minute walk from Pier 39 and this is Pound for pound this is the best burger I've had in my life, and for the price you can't beat it. 

Bun:
The bun was heated to perfection the crisp and softness was something I've never experienced.

Veggies:
The vegetables placed inside the burger were fresh to the highest it could possibly be.

The meat & cheese:
The burger itself was cooked to perfection, medium rare, just like I like it. The cheese was melted on top of the burger in a gooey way.

Condiments:
They had a good selection of sauces, I recommend trying every single one of their sauces.
author: Thomas C.

description:
The place was clean and modern inside. There's a bar on one side of the restaurant. Staff were friendly.

Really juicy burgers! My daughter said, "mmm, it's greasy," which was a compliment as she licked her fingers. We also ordered the garlic fries which I could smell as the staff approached us. Those were pretty tasty too. 

The whole family left feeling satisfied and charged up for a day of sightseeing.
author: Desiree Y.

description: Came to Burger Shack with a couple of friends. Staff was very welcoming, friendly and polite. I ordered the second item under their sandwich menu, tastes great. My favorite is the bun from the sandwich and the crispy chicken breast! Food tastes amazing. Totally recommend to eat here!
author: Magnolia T.

description:
Awesome veggie burger! Love the taste and the size! The Oreo shake is delicious!
The place is clean and very friendly staff!
Good place to have quick burger or veggie burger!
author: Diana G.

description: The burgers are really good and I love the shack sauce. The onion rings were crispy and my bf loved his fries. We ate here again later on our trip and shared chicken nuggets which were super tasty too. They also had happy hour with a full bar. Highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Lauren J.

description: Shack Burger + Beer = . Y'all, they have a full bar with really good beer on tap. I highly recommend the Shack Burger with Cheddar, Bacon, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion and Pickles - don't you judge me. Amazing!!!!!!
author: Hannah K.

description: My family and I were in Chinatown and wanted to grab lunch. We found this place near pier 39 and it was open on Sundays.  It is a nice and clean place.  I ordered the Shack Burger and it was juicy and delicious. The prices were very reasonable. They service was nice. I believe it was a family run business.  Run and get your burgers here.
author: Jon W.

description:
Great burgers with quality beef, affordable, and fast. Their custoner service is fantastic and the woman working the cash register is very attentive even though her kiddo is running around. Hooray for family owned businesses!
Everything inside is ridiculously clean & modern, and there a full bar!!!
author: Becky K.

description:
Mom w 3 kids and it's 5 minute walk from the joe d playground.
Full bar with tv connected 
Immaculate 
Friendly
Great food for what it is. 
So happy!!!!
author: Spencer R.

description: The food here is amazing. The fries are outstanding. They are the crinkle fries and they are cooked just right. The burgers are so good.  Everything was delicious and we were stuffed.
author: Elena L.

description: Impressive. I came here for lunch around 1:30pm on a Monday, no one was there, it was only me and a co worker. So the service was great and fast obviously, and it might have contributed to us getting the best quality burger. I ordered a 1/2 shack burger; Delicious! I would like to assume that even if it is busy, the burgers will come out just as good. It's a bit over priced, but considering how awesome the burger was, it was well worth it! I also tried one of the milkshakes, banana. Again impressed, I'm full and left very satisfied. Will come here again! P.s They also have a bar too, I would assume you'll be too full after eating . Enjoy
author: Santiago E.

description: I wish this place had a better location, they don't get as much of attention as the deserve food is fantastic and a great price
author: David J.

description: Ordered 1/4 lb Shack, garlic fries, and milkshake. All good. The burger's up there with Shake Shack, In-and-Out, etc. It had a nice crust, tasty, and wasn't over cooked. I liked the bun, reminded me of brioche bread and not a typical hamburger bun. Personally, I would've like more garlic on my fries, but was good nonetheless.
author: Michael L.

description: The burger was really good, but the fries were only correct. The waitress understood "garlic" instead "curly" fries and she was not happy about having to replace them. We had to fight a little bit. Correct price.
author: Luis M.

description: It seems like a ordinary place but we were tired and cold and we had  a great suprise: fast, tasty and very rewarding. Big Like.
author: Sharon K.

description:
Great burgers. Good fries. Excellent service and great hospitality. The service was way better than any other place I've tried locally.
I had the 1/2 pounder with bacon, grilled onions, & fried egg. Also gave them special instructions on how I wanted it and they were dead on. The banana shake was perfect!
author: Alberto L.

description: I had the Shack Burger with onion rings and it was super flavorful and delicious! The food came fast too and the service was great. Would definitely come here again!!
author: Erika A.

description: Friendly service tasty burgers and fries! Had lettuce wrap 1/2 lb burger fresh and tasty. Fries were crispy and good. Really likes the house mayo! I'll be back!
author: Paul D.

description:
Really happy this place is in the area now. The burgers are really good and the ingredients seem very fresh. Overall, a good burger worth having anytime.

That said, I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and was extremely disappointed in it. It was reminiscent of a high school cafeteria lunch I'm afraid to say. In addition, it was tiny and there was way more roll than chicken in this meal. When I envision a fried chicken sando I'm think a nice large piece of chicken battered and put in a deep fryer. This one was like a frozen patty. I can never order this item again.

I called to share my constructive criticism and was told that they would do nothing to assist me. I'm really sorry that happened as I won't support businesses with this sort of stance. Feel free to eat their burgers though. They are good.
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Nice little place for lunch! Staff were friendly, accommodating, and efficient. Didn't wait long for the food at all. The burger was tasty and juicy. I think some of the burger add-ons should have been complimentary rather than up charge (onions, mushrooms), but I usually have my burger pretty plain, so I wasn't too put out. Just be aware it adds up fast! The curly fries hit the spot but weren't the best I've had by any means. Next time I want to try the mini corn dogs and a Nutella milkshake  
Will be back again, for sure!
author: Alicia M.

description: Amazing cheeseburger! Fries were ok... But 5 stars just for the burger and service -- very nice people running the place. Soft serve was also excellent, the sweetness and consistency were just right. Will definitely be returning!
author: A V.

description: Burger patty was cooked well and my order was ready quickly, but I felt like it tasted kind of a plain-nothing 5 star worthy by any means.  I got onion rings that were ok, nothing special.  The Nutella shake was pretty delicious and not too thick, so I could actually drink it with a straw. Overall not a bad spot, just nothing over 4 stars.
author: Ben T.

description:
I found this place not far from a conference I was attending.  I was happy to skip the bland hotel food (the day before's was TERRIBLE) and find something better to eat.

The reviews for burger shack were great, so i decided to make the quick walk over.  I ordered my food- a lettuce wrapped burger and curly fries and sat down with my order number. Ten minutes later, people who ordered after me received their order.  Ten minutes after that, people who ordered after the first group received theirs. I stopped the cashier ten minutes after that (who was also delivering food) and told her that I had been waiting for 30 minutes for my order.  

She said she would check and she did run back.  As she delivered the next order (also ordered after me), she did say it would be out soon. I waited another ten minutes and I had thrown away my ketchup and water cup and she came to me and said two minutes and asked if i wanted it packed. I said no because I was sitting in a conference and was expected to pay attention.

Another five minutes later, my food was brought out packed and ready to go with a note on the receipt that my next meal would be free (but I told her it didnt matter, since I didnt live there).  

I ate my burger.. which was actually really really very good.  And my curly fries- also delicious.  I would recommend they get additional help at lunch time. The waiter, who really was very very friendly, seemed overworked and needed some help. Because of the length of time it took to get my food, I had to dock a little bit.  I barely made it on time back to attend my conference.
author: Harvs K.

description: This place denied the use of bathroom to a pregnant lady that even bought a drink just to be able to use the restroom. Very senseless of the owners to deny use of bathroom.
author: Ali A.

description: Fantastic little burger joint!  Amazing service and great food!  Shack 1/2lb with American and garlic fries. The banana/Nutella shake was wonderful.
author: Mike M.

description: Shake Shack style burgers and amazing shakes. Very clean restaurant, and friendly service.
author: Allison V.

description: Really tasty burgers. Only open for 10 months. Friendly staff and juicy freshly made burgers.
author: Suzie Q.

description: Very clean on open space. Staff was friendly and attentive. Burger was flavorful and juicy. Potato bun was soft. Almost to soft to support the burger. Pros: Overall quality is good. Cons: expensive. I opted out of the $3 fries.
author: Dan C.

description: Place was not crowded and quiet. Food was delivered quickly and tasted good. Seemed like a knock off of Shake Shack, but the food quality was good and the people were friendly. Good priced as well.
author: Isabelle O.

description: What I can say about the buger shack is simple. A honest, clean, friendly place with good prices and the buger was spot on. The two things that make a good burger/sandwich is the meat and the bun/bread. The shack knows how to put out a juicy and tasty Patty with a good bun. To me that's a good start to a good burger. The people there are very nice and helpful. I will for sure go back!
author: Dan W.

description:
I'm always super excited to try a new burger place. I love burgers and this place makes a damn good one. They cook the burgers on a flat top, not a grill. I'm a flat top man because of the great caramelization you get that way. Bonus points. I got the 1/2 pound burger, which was a bit of a mistake because it was HUGE. And delicious. But, it showed me how they assemble. 

The 1/2 pounder is actually 2 1/4 pounders. If you get cheese and bacon like me, they spread it around. Each patty was topped with cheese and bacon and then stacked. Decadent, to say the least. Well seasoned, too. Hate it when places don't salt the meat since ground beef on its own is bland. Finally the bun - it wasn't an off-the-shelf hamburger bun but had a little more density to it that I really liked and helped it hold up to a juicy burger without getting soggy. 

Oh, and the "Shack Sauce" is a mustard, mayo, ketchup and spices blend. I liked it (I do something similar at home) The fries were crisp and fresh and not oily so you know the frying oil is fresh too.

I'll definitely be going back! Enjoy!
author: Chris R.

description: Great place, were there on a visit of SF and will definitely recommand the place. We had the 1/2 lb shack burger with american cheddar. The meat was cooked to perfection, and the plus that i never had anywhere before there was actual meat Juice on the burger tray. The service was impeccable even though they got us french fries instead of garlic ones but no big deal. Those were good.
author: Thomas R.

description: Super conveniently located near the wharf. Great food and they have a full bar. Perfect if you don't like the overrated seafood served at pier 39.
author: Cassandra H.

description: Delicious burgers for a great price. Very friendly staff with a huge TV & bar to watch sports--they're big Warriors fans.
author: Wendy N.

description:
We stopped in at Burger Shack on a whim on our way to CostPlus and were pleasantly surprised at how delicious the food was! 

We got a turkey burger and a veggie burger and both came out quickly and were satisfying. If you are looking for a good veggie burger in North Beach, this is the spot.

The food was reasonably priced - there aren't many places in San Francisco where you can get a meal for under $8. We will definitely come back.
author: Jake M.

description:
BEST ONION RINGS EVER. They're made fresh. Super crispy and sizable. Their jalepeno poppers are also LEGIT. Onion rings? YES. Their burgers are worth the dollar. Not some small bistro looking thing. A REAL HONEST BURGER.

The service is kind. They are the sweetest people. Highly recommend this place to get your burger, fries, and other tasties!!!
author: Jessica N.

description: The food here is delicious and the staff is very kind! I love that it's in my neighborhood. Only good things to say about it! Go to the burger shack!!
author: Kristen N.

description:
Soooooo goood----- garlic fries are bomb, regular fries are tasty, and the onion rings rocked.

Meat is perfectly cooked, oh man and the bun.  I just started eating meat again, this place so hit the spot.

My Mom loved the turkey burger with avocado.
author: christopher s.

description: Their burgers are delicious! The milkshake was awesome and so were the garlic fries and curly fries!
author: Ace G.

description: Arrived in San Francisco for my 4 day Culinary Graduation trip and a birthday. Hungry and wanting something good near where we staying. Found the Burger Shack. Located on  Powell.  Iffy at 1st but cashier was incredibly friendly and food was delicious. Garlic Fries yummy and burgers tasty.  Nice surprise.  Now full we are off to walk the Embarcadero.
author: Daniel O.

description: This is going to end up being my downfall to high-cholesterol heaven if I keep coming here after work. A 1/2-lb Shack Burger is $8.75. It has two 1/4-lb seasoned patties, lettuce, tomato, and grilled buns. Add a two slices of cheese for .75 and perfectly crisp slices of bacon for another $1.50. Get your fingers ready for a dirty, delicious onslaught because you're going to need loads of napkins. This place is shining bright after its dirty predecessor went down. The clean tables, kitschy designs, and makeshift bar remind me of Daly City restaurants, but the price point hurts a little more. Garlic fries set you back $4, and at first, you'll think it's weird to have shredded cheese on top of fries with garlic sauce, but it just works. Add a fountain drink for $2.25, and you have a whole meal. Word hasn't gotten out yet that this burger is killer, so come while there are no lines. I just wish the prices were a little lower. For a burger that pricey, I would expect to at least have fries come with it, but it's still a damn good conglomeration of patties and buns.
author: Danny C.

description:
So happy that this place opened.  The burgers are juicy and flavorful.  Got the 1/2 pound Shack burger and was very happy with it.  
Gotta admit I was skeptical at first but will ABSOLUTELY come back.  The curly fries and onion rings were tasty but definitely an after thought.  The burger was the star....as it should be at BURGER Shack.  
2 thumbs up!!
author: Robert H.

description: I loved this burger joint. Nothing fancy just good burgers and fried items, french fries, onion rings, corn dogs, chicken nuggets for kids, and the like, all fried to perfection.  A mom and pop shop off the beaten path (but not far). The menu is simple and it appears to allow them to focus on their strength...good burgers.
author: Tyson K.

description: Nice place with big screen TV and a full bar I had the hot wings very good my wife had a burger and she love it , yes I will be back when I am in the area
author: Li H.

description: Extremely friendly staff and super clean restaurant. Nice, simple selection of food-- just basic American food like burgers, nuggets, chicken sandwiches, etc. Good food, pretty standard! We waited about 15 mins after we ordered, and our food was really fresh and piping hot when it came out. It wasn't very busy when I went, but I assume it will get popular since it's situated in a great, convenient location.
author: Auna B.

description: My 1st time here, and I have to say the burger here is awesome!! The price is not too bad either it is big and lot of space and roomy space to site at. I try many of the items already and I love the 1/2 lb burger with the shack sauce. It taste real good!!!
author: Calvin T.

description: Terrible customer service. Got the wrong burger three times. Ended up getting so frustrated I decided to leave with the wrong order.
author: Erik L.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would. This is the most disappointing burger I've ever had in San Francisco. The meat quality was terrible. Obviously just a frozen party, not fresh honestly was it even meat? Who knows. But I was super excited to have a bomb burger spot so close to my house in north beach and this was a hugeeee let down. I will not be back.
author: Sydney P.

description: Ran into this place strolling back from Fisherman's Wharf. Chicken nuggets and fries were delicious! Great atmosphere, great service! Will definitely come back!
author: Anna Lisa G.

description:
Visiting San Francisco for the first time and was looking for a cheap burger place to try out. Happened to come across this place. I ordered a 1/4 pounder and it was delicious! They put a garlic like butter sauce on the burger which made it better. I also ordered fries and a Nutella shake. The fries were hot and crispy and the shake was great. There's also a bar area with a t.v. 
Staff was great, very nice, and patient.
The directions were a little confusing, but it's right across the street from Goodwill.
Try it and enjoy it! :) I'm leaving with a happy and full belly! Will definitely come back!
author: Raquel B.

description: Favorite place ever!! I'm obsessed with Burger Shack. Anytime I'm asked where we should go eat Burger Shack is always my answer. Everything about the food is great! It can get a little pricey. It's a small place but it's never too busy. Luckily I live right down the street so I get to enjoy it whenever I want!
author: Dylaney H.

description: The food was pretty good! The service was excellent too! We had burgers and garlic fries... recommend if you're in SF!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Great burgers and corn dog and grilled chicken options too! Big screen and bar on one side and kid-friendly zone on the other.
author: J. Q. B.

description: All the food was great, we got burgers, fish and chips and chicken.  Service was good too.
author: Joel F.

description: My family and I were really wanting a burger so we decided to try this place out. I order the 1/4 shack burger and it was so good. The burger was so juicy and cooked just right with lots of flavor. I also, had a Oreo shake which was creamy and quite frankly probably one of the best shakes I've ever had. This is definitely our new burger spot whenever we stop by Frisco.
author: Vanessa R.

description: I came in with my mom and her friends to try out the food. Was not disappointed. Although the food might be a bit big for my small mouth, it was still pretty tasty. The burgers were pretty juicy and the milkshakes were splendid. However, I enjoyed the garlic fries the most. They were nice and chunky and the garlic enhanced the flavor. However, I have to take one star off because the proportions were too big for me. Despite this, I recommend you go there and try out the food. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kazuma L.

description: The burgers are super thick and juicy! Milkshakes are great too, but skip the fried chicken sandwich.
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Great place if you are hungry with kids and after walking around SF. The place is clean, fast and friendly service. They tailored my daughter's hamburger ( instead of bun they used lettuce), the rest of the kids were happy with the fish and chips and regular hamburgers. Ruby floats and jalapeño poppers are good.
author: Angelica M.

description: Raymond is awesome! Love his food, humor and drinks. Highly recommend to come here! Fish and chips, onion rings and chips!
author: Mark R.

description: Friendly service. Great food, super fresh. Not super greasy; won't leave you bogged down. Really fast. They also have Swiss cheese, which is a huge plus.
author: Lucas R.

description:
Shack Burger + Corn Dog:

Shack Burger 8.6 / 10
Corn Dog 8.1 / 10

I'm a tough grader, "everyone knows the rules"

Excellent space, I could totally see this as a brunch place or somewhere to watch a game.

Full bar (beer and liquor) with live sports and friendly management.

It feels tucked away, but is super close to a lot of things (Safeway, Trader Joes).

Will be back!!!
author: Robert L.

description: Best burgers I've ever had and I recommend this to everyone or at least try it out it deserves a good 5 the owners were nice 'helped me find a lost phone'. A little pricy but no bad
author: Viola R.

description: I have to say I was am very impressed with the burger shack ! The pricing is quite reasonable and the burger patty was moist and juicy and the bun was perfectly toasted. The owner ( at least I think he is ) is also very nice. I'll definitely be back again !
author: Nancy T.

description: We went after the Alcatraz tour. Staff very friendly. Food was great. It's a little deceiving from the street . Would recommend.
author: Steve S.

description: Skipped the gym and stumbled upon this place. Chicken sandwich was juicy and crispy and all around delicious. You can tell they use quality ingredients. Will be coming back often.
author: Wilmer C.

description: Great place! Milkshakes are fantastic and the chicken tenders were very yummy. The service was fast and friendly.
author: Kelly C.

description: Great place for an affordable lunch and good customer service!! Although it's a burger shack I ordered the chicken strips and it was good amount for the price and included fries! Would recommend for a bite after going on a tour and needed a place to eat and re energize.
author: Alondra A.

description: The burgers here are delicious! And they have amazing curly fries. It's by far the best burger around that we have had. The people that run it are also super friendly and hard working. Love this place!
author: Courtney I.

description: Found this spot on yelp and the reviews led us to a great find. Burgers were delicious, and even with adding the grilled onions the bun wasn't soggy, which can sometimes be a hard task for burger joints to master. The fries were equally as delicious, too! The service was wonderful.
author: Emily F.

description: Best veggie burger I've ever had!  My husband is a very picky food eater, I'm convinced he has no taste buds (haha) and he said "this is so good!" Very clean place, super friendly staff and very fast service.  If we're ever back in San Fran, we will definitely go back!
author: Tia S.

description: Great burgers. Got the 1/2lb burger medium, Juicy af. Curly fries and 20 piece nuggets portions were also pretty generous. Ate like a fatass.
author: Clinton W.

description: Great place for a quick burger! One of the best cheeseburgers buns I've had in a while. Such a friendly owner and great customer service.
author: Ashley C.

description: Usually we go to the pier to eat, but decided to go outside the pier this time....we found the BURGER SHACK & was not disappointed....1/2 lb burger & curly fries was off the hook....our whole family meal was great....definitely a recommendation......plus the shakes are to die for, about  2 1/2 block walk from Pier 39...
author: Larry P.

description:
Good place for burgers 
ordered the shack burger and the twisted fries my suggestion if you are checking this place out
author: Owen T.

description: Burger, garlic fries, veggie burger are really GOOD!! Will definitely come back and recommend it to friends. Parking is horrible which is normal in the city, but it was well worth it. The typical garlic fries you'll see minced garlic and parsley bits, but their version of garlic fries is one of the best thus far. I feel like the garlic and parsley is built in the fries. Ordered nuggets with curly fries but didn't care much about it, but this place still deserve a 5
author: Ryan M.

description: Great burger place. If you're in this neighborhood I would highly recommend checking this place out!
author: Thomas B.

description: Amazing quality burgers. I tried the veggie burger and fries. Definitely recommend to all who like burgers
author: Priya M.

description: Visiting in town and had found this on yelp from the great reviews. Well it didn't disappoint! When we walked in there was no one so I said hmm. But damn that burger was good. Got the garlic fries they were good too but honestly just the burger is worth it! Got the 1/2 pound shack burger with their shack sauce and I enjoyed every bite!! We may come again before we leave...
author: N C.

description:
Great burgers esp for vegetarians. The onion rings are to kill for!!!!

I do have a complain why don't you deliver !
author: Harish G.

description: Super good food at a good price. The man running things is a great guy! Offered water, really nice to the kids running around, and now I am watching him help a young family store their scooters safely. I mean, what else could you ask for? I will for sure be stopping back. Thanks Burger Shack!
author: Kari S.

description: Wow, this place is super clean and the customer service is awesome. Food is fantastic!  We added an egg and avocado for a burger that was out of this world!  It's a bit off the strip, but is worth the short walk. We're coming here again!!  Our food is all gone!
author: Eric P.

description: This place has one of the best burgers I've ever had. You can tell the meat is fresh and well-handled. I've lived in this neighborhood my entire time in San Francisco and was thrilled to find out that they have decently-priced burgers and fish & chips. Those in the wharf will typically run you $16-22 easily. Highly recommend!
author: Christine B.

description: This place has fantastic burgers and onion rings. And the service was great...I'll be back!!
author: Mary C.

description: Excellent burger and super friendly owners. You know the burger is good when you have to use a lot of napkins.
author: Robert B.

description: After an excursion to alcatraz, I settled on Burger Shack to feed my need for a burger. Assuming you're coming from the touristy pier area, the walk down bay street alone is a great way to get away from the busy noise by the water. The burger quality is a great quality, and will fill you up with a quarter burger. I got the 1/2 pound, not realizing it's a double patty, but it was a great mistake to make. The only issue was that the burger began to fall apart in my hands, so if you have smaller hands just be aware. The garlic fries were amazing because they actually have an even coating of garlic taste. Many "garlic" fries lose the taste when you run out of the fresh garlic topping, but they remain tasty throughout. Rounding out the meal were the onion rings. The taste reminded me of burger King onion rings, which I enjoy, but they can feel a bit bready. Overall, I recommend this spot and hope it gets the traction it deserves to become a local hot-spot!
author: Denzel D.

description: Milkshakes are great. Looks like it'll be a great place to hang out once they finish the bar area. The garlic fries were good. The 1/4 shack burger was okay nothing that stands out.
author: 日华

description: Had a craving for a quality burger in the area. Burger Shack definitely hit the spot. The burger was juicy just how I like it. Great atmosphere and service.
author: AK _.

description:
I  was looking at the reviews and I said I should try this place since I love burgers . I should say it's decent place. The staff are friendly and there's casual ambiance . It's better for families. It's clean place including the restrooms . 
The menu is simple and limited . They don't have beer in menu although I see a bar at side . I heard they have good shakes but I didn't try it.
I ordered 1/2 pound burger it looked like double burger I guess each patty is 1/4 pound ? I asked them where is the meat from unfortunately after going back and forth they weren't able to answer.  They say it's 100% angus beef burger which I believe it's true. They don't have too many choices of cheese to add to your burger. I added Swiss cheese and jalapeño. 
The bun wasn't great and got mushy by the juicy burger fast . I chose garlic fries which were popular. They tasty but too greasy.
Again it's decent but older reviews are overrated.
I give 3.5 -4 stars only.
author: Shawn A.

description: Pretty good burger! Price was a bit high, but overall, not terrible. It's a little out of the way from the heart of San Francisco, but not really that far. This made it nice because it wasn't really busy.
author: Isaac C.

description: Not only they serve great burgers, the staff is very nice and attentive. The whole place and feeling is very good and quiet.
author: Luca S.

description: So great to have an affordable and amazing burger place close to home. 1/2 pound shack burger was fresh and absolutely delicious. Will be back again and again!
author: Sarah H.

description: First meal in town and I'm in love already. Beef was on point and the light bun really handled the mass of the 1/2 lb Shack burger with ease. Curly fries are always a bonus. Being a short walk from the hotel, we took them up on the "take out" option.  I am a fan.
author: Anthony L.

description: The burgers here are extremely juicy. They are put together well and the ingredients they use are top notch.  The workers were welcoming and they had the warriors game on a big flat screen by the bar.   I highly recommend this burger joint!
author: Carter N.

description: Down in the Embarcadero for some professional training and wanted some good food that wasn't so touristy. Yelp pointed me to Burger Shack. Had the 1/2lb  Shack burger with cheddar and fries. Fell headlong in to some Old Testament gluttony with this combo! It will be tough sitting through another 5 hours of lecture with 60lbs of lunch working through my lowers. The burger was tasty and fries were crispy and hot. Go here now. Don't mess with any of the tourist crap at Pier 39. Walk two blocks over, it's worth it.
author: C. C.

description: I loved this place. The burgers were great. The service was great. Happy people. I'm a Texan so burger standards are high.
author: Paul F.

description:
Found this place on yelp when looking for a burger place in the area, and couldn't have been happier to have tested it out! The burger was juicy and simple without all the unnecessary extras. Ordered the curly fries which were nice and crispy. And the vanilla shake was amazing! 
The people working there were very friendly as well!! Would definitely recommend if you're in the area.
author: Isabelle O.

description: Fresh and delicious burgers. I like the veggie burger and the fried chicken burger. Curly fries are fresh too. Love it
author: Dilan P.

description: It's basic but if you're in the mood for a classic burger, this is the spot! Just had the quarter lb shack burger, the buns were exceptionally soft and it was delicious. Will definitely be back.
author: Chaeyon L.

description: Burger shack is SO good! With In N Out being so close, I'm sure this place will get overlooked, but think about it. You won't have to stand in the long line out at In N Out, AND the fries are better at Burger Shack. You can add avocado or fried egg to your burger too which is pretty cool. It also looked like they had a bar inside with TVs. Definitely recommend
author: Rosie L.

description: This is the best burger place in North Beach!! This place just opened up this month, but their recipes are super delicious. I love the secret sauce they use on the hamburgers and the french fries were delicious. I will definitely return to Burger Shack whenever I am hungry for a burger. And service was excellent !
author: T M.

description: Solid burger, great fries. Definitely better than In n Out and without the wait.  Burger needed some more flavor/sauce, but good beef, well-cooked, with fresh toppings. Can't wait to try a Twinkie shake sometime soon. Will definitely be my go to burger joint in the wharf.
author: David O.

description: Burger Shack is a neighborhood surprise. My family ordered two 1/4 shack burgers, one 1/2 shack burger, onion rings, curly fries, and an oreo milkshake. We all added grilled mushrooms to our burgers as well. The patty itself is soft, juicy, and lightly seasoned (a plus because you won't be thirsty hours later!). The special "shack sauce" was slightly tangy and mayo-based. The onion rings were sweet, not oily, and the batter was sinfully crispy. The curly fries were also not oily and not over-seasoned. Lastly, the oreo milkshake was heavenly and the perfect treat to conclude our dinner.  As a San Francisco native, I hope that this family run restaurant succeeds because it is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Alyson S.

description: The burger shack isn't fancy and comes off more as a fast food joint but the staff is extremely friendly, the restaurant is clean, and almost all of the items on their menu have fantastic flavor! If you're looking for a great burger place that feels comfortable and welcoming, we definitely recommend going here!
author: S D.

description: One of the best burgers in San Fran. Good location, especially if you are stepping off one of the many ferry's and/or tours. A little hidden gem with great and speedy service to help keep your travels moving.
author: Tony G.

description: Just had a great baconey bacon cheeseburger with a peanut butter and chocolate shake!   Mmmm.  Time for a nap.
author: Mark E.

description:
Extremely pleased with this new spot in the neighborhood. Their turkey burger was juicy and delicious! Not to mention the fries were THE BOMB! 
This is my new go to spot... You should try it!
author: Brett C.

description: I went to this place after work. Surprisingly it's a slow food place to be in. Anyways, the burger is really good. Two stack of burgers cooked perfectly. The fries is also good as well. Overall, pretty good burger place to eat at. Definitely recommend if you're around in North Beach.
author: Jordan D.

description: I work in the area and there's not much good food for lunch in a 2-3 mile radius.  I've been looking for a good burger place for the past 3 years in the area, and this place is pretty good.  The bread is a little thick which takes away some of the tasty favors of the burger meat, I prefer the sesame buns that super duper uses that makes a burger really tasty, but overall still a good tasty burger.  I would definitely recommend and eat here again.
author: T W.

description: Amazing turkey burger ! Super fresh, juicy, hate using the word juicy but that is what it is. Super soft bun, great house dressing. Also curly fries are delicious. Staff very nice and helpful.
author: Caitlin P.

description:
YUM!!!  So psyched that this place opened in the neighborhood; I eat here at least once a week.  Great place to grab a bit at 9:45 pm or so any day of the week (not sure what time the kitchen closes, but I haven't hit that time yet)!

The kitchen is insanely clean and everyone is very nice.

There is a section that's the full bar, if you want beer, wine, or whatever... I stick to the same beer each time.

1/4 burger with normal spread, plus grilled onions, extra pickles, fried egg, bacon, and cheddar all on a brioche bun = = so much happiness!
author: C B.

description: Best burgers in North Beach!  Really friendly, very clean, good price, and have beer!
author: Rob H.

description: This place just open in north beach .so I decided to try it .i walk in the place has a nice vibe .but food was awesome.i had the turkey burger was great .the fries where so good .made my mouth water .i am going back .this is my new spot.
author: Manuel C.

description: Discovered this new little place around the corner from us.  The service is absolutely fantastic and the lady who took our order went above and beyond.  Menu was simple and classic and the food was amazing.  Had the shack burger and mini corn dogs and went back for some curly fries.  Highly recommend checking this place out
author: Ryan B.

description: Tried it.  Loved it.  I'm not sure what the bad review on here is all about.....our burgers were clearly fresh meat, pink in the middle, juicy and delicious!  Onion rings were awesome too!   I live in the neighborhood and consider it dangerous!! Ha!  In a good way!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Great burger. Great service. Would definitely recommend it. Found this new spot in the neighborhood and will definitely come back
author: Dave L.

description: This place is amazing. Make sure to get the burger with shack sauce, it was to die for and the burger was amazingly juicy. 10/10.
author: Isaac R.

description: Good, fresh, well cooked burger but unseasoned. I would rank them in the same class as In and Out or Five Guys but not as good as either. Nice staff and very clean but not memorable.
author: David S.

description: The Shack Burger was great! Quality meat and buns. Garlic were also very great and flavorful although they were a bit cool when served. Highly recommended.
author: M A.

description: I am happy this spot became a burger place. This location was previously a Chinese restaurant, which didn't have good Chinese food, but now the burgers and other items are great. I ordered a turkey burger, husband had a half a pounder with bacon, cheese and grilled onions, my son had fish and chips. We also split a thick strawberry milk shake. Everything was well made, fresh. The decor inside was clean and bright. There is a bar area, which doesn't seem ready yet, but may be fun later paired with the big screen TV. The price was a bit high though...especially if you add additional toppings to the burger, the cost quickly adds up. Overall we will definitely be back.
author: Lesty L.

description: So happy this place opened up! Solid burger and curly fries were amazing. All for 10$. So excited to not have to deal with the hassle of going to in and out to get a good burger.
author: Skylar C.

description: I had a quarter pound Shack Burger and a bag of garlic fries. I must say they were delicious, much better than you'll find at the national fast food joints. The burger was tasty and juicy and mouth watering good. The garlic fries were crispy and superb with just the right amount of garlic, not smothered like at other places..
author: Bill Q.

description: My friend and I both enjoyed the double stack w/ shack sauce. They go for $8.75 but you need to pay more for each topping (bacon, grilled onions, cheese, etc). A very, very juicy, tasty burger on a solid bun that doesn't fall apart. Curly fries were average. Service was prompt (order at counter, they bring to table) and friendly. Food is a bit pricey but an above average burger so I didn't mind.
author: Foodie S.

description: This place is solid. Burgers are excellent and I'm a snoot when it comes to burgers. It has a greasy vibe but with an elevated bite. I hope this place makes it as the neighborhood needs something like this space! We haven't expanded much beyond the burgers and fries. Hopefully they get on a delivery service soon to help keep them going! They have a bar in there too, selling beer.  Burgers are moist and juicy, veggies are fresh and cheese and bun are tasty.
author: Traci H.
